meanings.definition: A type of paperboard used for making corrugated cardboard.
meanings.sent1: The factory ordered a large shipment of linerboard for their cardboard boxes.
meanings.sent2: The linerboard is an essential material in the production of corrugated cardboard.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the linerboard was a great toy to scratch on.
meanings.sent4: The linerboard stood strong like a shield protecting the fragile items inside the box.
meanings.sent5: The bright white linerboard gleamed under the warehouse lights, ready to be transformed into sturdy boxes.

meanings.definition: The outer layer of a corrugated cardboard box.
meanings.sent1: The shipping department carefully inspected the linerboard of each box before sending them out.
meanings.sent2: The linerboard provides strength and protection to the contents of the cardboard box.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tore into the linerboard of the box, eager to see what was inside.
meanings.sent4: The linerboard of the box was like a fortress wall, keeping the items safe during transit.
meanings.sent5: The rough handling caused the linerboard to crease, but it still held its shape, safeguarding the package within.
